Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was genuine or entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's husband found not credible due to financial dependence and lack of effort to work in Mexico
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Financial records, marital cohabitation evidence, immigration history
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Regulation 4(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Primary purpose of marriage was to obtain status in Canada
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Factor: Failed refugee claimant with removal order
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship denied due to suspicion of convenience marriage
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD erred in dismissing the appeal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of independent financial activity, limited contact after return to Mexico
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Appeal process followed with right to judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Husband’s intent to remain in Canada outweighed marital authenticity
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IAD’s credibility assessment and finding of non-genuine marriage
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review of administrative decisions

Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was not genuine and entered into primarily for immigration benefits
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Husband’s actions indicated primary intent to remain in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Financial dependency, immigration status, post-return behavior
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Regulation 4(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Marriage entered into primarily to gain immigration status
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Disjunctive test under Regulation 4(1): not genuine OR primarily for status
Crimes.Application_Factor: Husband was a failed refugee claimant under removal order
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship refused due to marriage fraud suspicion
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD erred in concluding marriage was not genuine
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Limited efforts to sustain life in home country, financial reliance on sponsor
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Full appeal and review rights exercised
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of marital relationship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that relationship was genuine despite immigration benefit
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review of administrative tribunal decisions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Marriage not genuine / entered for immigration advantage
